Hector.Action: Calls out to his son to go back home and leave him alone.
Plays roughly with his children, but throws his son too hard causing injury.
Kneels beside his daughter, fascinated and delighted by her dreaming.
Engages in intimate, loving moment with Deirdre.
Calls out to his son to go back home, showing awareness and control of the situation.
Plays roughly with his children, but throws his son too hard causing injury.
Observes his daughter's dreaming with fascination and attentiveness.
Rejects his son’s wish to go foraging together, repeatedly telling him to stay and showing anger.
Acknowledges the no-win situation between himself, his son, and Deirdre, showing awareness of family dynamics and frustration.
Smiles while observing seabirds and feels a sense of belonging and companionship with his environment and family.
Runs to warn or protect his family upon seeing a potential threat approaching the bay.
Surveys his environment calmly and confidently, showing awareness of his surroundings and their resources.
Notices smoke and immediately runs to a vantage point to assess potential threats, demonstrating alertness and quick response.
Experiences blind, gut-turning fear upon seeing hostile boats, which may indicate a momentary loss of composure but also realistic emotional response.
Shouts instructions to his children to manage their panic and keep the fire burning in their absence.
Gathers his family together and leads them to leave the cave to escape danger.
Argues with Deirdre about the safest direction to take the children, showing concern for their safety.
Herds the children in front of him, following Deirdre despite disagreement, prioritizing their safety.
Picks up the little girl who tries to retrieve a dropped toy and carries her over his shoulder to keep her safe.
Gathers his wits and strength to continue racing up the hillside despite exhaustion.
Shouts instructions to his children to prevent them from taking too much during the hurried evacuation and insists on keeping the fire burning.
Attempts to direct his family up the hill based on his observation of the raiders' position.
Engages in a hasty argument with Deirdre about the best escape route, but ultimately follows her lead despite his conviction.
Carries his little girl over his shoulder to prevent her from going back for a dropped toy, prioritizing safety over possessions.
Almost stops to help Deirdre but chooses to run on with the children.
In a moment of panic, lets go of his son and drops the girl to run on alone.
Stops and turns back to his children despite the danger, feeling guilt.
Almost stops to help Deirdre but decides to run on with the children instead.
Carries the Girl awkwardly and half-drags the Boy up a steep slope while being pursued.
In a moment of panic, lets go of his son and drops the Girl to run on alone.
Stops and turns back to the children despite the danger, driven by guilt and responsibility.
Hoists his two children into the branches of a tree to keep them safe, instructs them to stay quiet and try to sleep despite hunger and cold.
Looks back anxiously at his children before leaving them alone for the night.
Returns to watch over his children from a distance, cautious and protective.
Carefully hoists his children into a tree for safety and instructs them to stay quiet and still, showing foresight and protective planning.
Wakes from a fitful sleep, assesses his surroundings, and moves cautiously, indicating alertness and situational awareness.
Observes the raider from a distance, using cover and listening carefully, demonstrating patience and tactical caution.
Does not intervene when the raider persuades his children to come down from the tree, potentially risking their safety.
Watches his family happily integrated with the Raiders, feels pain but does not lash out or act aggressively.
Retreats into darkness after seeing his family taken away, showing restraint despite his pain.
Observes the Raiders' camp from a hidden position, assessing the situation carefully without revealing himself.
Retreats quietly into the darkness when the situation becomes too painful, avoiding rash or impulsive actions.
Does not attempt to intervene or rescue his family despite seeing them, showing passivity in a critical moment.
Spends a long, cold night alone, showing endurance but no social interaction or comfort sought.
Watches his family silently, noting their fear and restrained emotion.
Breaks cover and runs toward departing Raiders, screaming and throwing stones in a desperate, emotional outburst.
Faces the Raiders fiercely despite their mocking laughter, showing sincerity and emotional openness.
Spends a long, cold night alone without sleep or comfort, showing endurance but no active problem-solving.
Responds to the morning rain with a sense of revival and moves forward toward the shore, showing resilience and acceptance of circumstances.
Breaks cover and charges at the departing Raiders, screaming and throwing stones in a desperate, impulsive act.
Stands his ground and fiercely returns the Raiders' mocking looks despite being outmatched and powerless.
Remains passive and non-resistant when seized by raiders despite his family's fear.
His children instinctively try to defend him but are held back by Deirdre, showing Hector's family is concerned for him.
Remains calm and does not resist when captured and bound by the Raiders despite the threat to himself and his family.
Does not understand the intentions or the cultural significance of the Priest and Leader's actions and questions, showing confusion and lack of comprehension.
Shows no visible attempt to communicate or negotiate with the Leader or Priest when confronted, appearing passive and bemused.
Sits quietly while others decide his fate, tries to unpick the rope binding his hands, then follows the group despite being rejected.
Remains shocked and does not react in any meaningful way to the group's rejection.
Sits silently, shocked and unable to react meaningfully when left behind and bound.
Attempts to unpick the rope binding his hands after being abandoned.
Follows the group after being left behind, first running then trotting to catch up.
Persistently follows the Raiders despite being rejected and treated as an embarrassment, showing his desperate need for connection.
Refuses the cut piece of rope offered by the Raider as a conciliatory gesture, indicating pride or sorrow but also a lack of acceptance of their gesture.
Persistently follows the Raiders despite being repeatedly shooed away, showing attachment but lacking strategic thinking or assertiveness.
Passively accepts the cutting of his ropes without resistance or attempt to influence the situation, showing resignation rather than skill or confidence.
Refuses the piece of rope offered by the Raider, indicating some awareness or principle despite his helplessness.
Retraces his steps to pick up the piece of rope that bound him, recognizing it might be useful.
Expertly wafts and blows at the fire's remains to revive it, demonstrating skill in physical survival.
Stands alert and attentive to his master's needs, showing concern on his face.
Emotionally detached from surroundings, described as a man alone.
Stands alert and attentive to his master's needs, immediately moves to assist when his master climbs out of the pool, produces a stool for his master to sit on as if by magic.
Emotionally detached and alone, showing no engagement beyond his duties.
Produces a small wooden stool for his master to sit on as he joins others.
Watches his master being patronized and winces, sharing his master's feelings of discomfort.
Quickly stands by Lucinnius's side as they leave after being insulted.
Follows closely behind his master carrying all his belongings, ready to assist.
Produces a small wooden stool for his master to sit on as he joins others.
Moves out of earshot but remains alert to his master's behavior.
Quickly stands and stays by Lucinnius's side as they leave after being insulted.
Carries multiple items (towel, scrubber, robe, stool) and follows closely behind his master.
Carries all necessary items for Lucinnius and stays close behind him, attentive to his needs.
Responds promptly and obediently to Lucinnius's request for food, showing attentiveness.
Offers to share his bread with other slaves and engages in friendly conversation with them.
Quickly adapts food order when mice are unavailable, securing alternative provisions for Lucinnius.
Keeps watch on Lucinnius and attends to his needs attentively.
Joins other slaves and initiates conversation, showing social awareness and gathering information.
Passively receives surprising news about his master’s situation without immediate reaction or intervention.
Listens thoughtfully to the slaves' grim news without mocking or dismissing them.
Shows attentiveness and support by moving closer to Lucinnius to aid conversation.
Responds to Lucinnius' troubles with brief, practical remarks but does not offer emotional comfort or encouragement.
Resumes formal roles quickly after casual conversation, showing adherence to social hierarchy rather than warmth.
Listens carefully to the slaves' news and processes the implications thoughtfully, nodding and reflecting on the situation.
Engages attentively with Lucinnius, asking relevant questions about the financial troubles and the ships.
Shows no immediate plan or solution despite understanding the gravity of the situation; remains passive and does not take initiative.
Concentrates on concocting appropriate responses for his difficult role.
Obeys Lucinnius's order to fetch chickens and the diviner Hermas without complaint.
Concentrates on concocting appropriate responses in a tough, competitive environment, showing focus and adaptability.
Passively follows Lucinnius' orders without questioning or contributing additional insight (e.g., fetching the diviner).
Counts out coins for Hermas promptly when asked.
Gives Lucinnius a soothing shoulder massage while listening to his troubles.
Encourages Lucinnius to visit Cyprian and not give up, supporting his resolve.
Calmly counts out coins to pay Hermas without hesitation.
Gives Lucinnius a soothing shoulder massage, helping him relax and regain resolve.
Encourages Lucinnius to visit Cyprian and try to reason with him, showing good judgment and confidence.
Smiles ruefully at Lucinnius's plans, indicating awareness but no direct challenge or alternative plan.
Discreetly leaves the room after being told, showing obedience but no warmth.
Carefully moves through the room not to disturb sleeping slaves, showing consideration for others.
Sits close to Thalia and puts an arm around her, indicating closeness and affection.
Speaks frankly about a man with no money and many enemies, showing a realistic but somewhat unsympathetic view.
Follows instructions promptly and discreetly, taking the torch and leaving the room quietly.
Carefully moves through the house at night without disturbing others, showing awareness and caution.
Finds and climbs a ladder to access the roof, demonstrating resourcefulness and physical capability.
Engages in a thoughtful conversation with Thalia, analyzing the situation and the character of 'he' with insight.
Admits that the person they discuss is 'not very clever' and 'clumsy and sad,' showing critical judgment but also a somewhat resigned or negative view.
Puts an arm around Thalia, offering physical comfort and companionship.
Engages in sincere, intimate conversation about their situation and hopes, showing vulnerability and connection.
Reassures Thalia he will never leave her, expressing loyalty and commitment.
Admits uncertainty about his family and their location, showing honesty.
Yawns while speaking, showing tiredness but continuing to engage, indicating sincerity and presence.
Comforts Thalia with physical intimacy and reassuring words, showing emotional support and presence.
Admits he does not know the direction of his family home and acknowledges the improbability of returning, showing realistic self-awareness.
Expresses tiredness and yawns while speaking, indicating possible fatigue or lack of energy.
Smiles at the couple in the henhouse, showing understanding and tolerance of their relationship.
Politely apologizes for disturbing the couple and offers them the roof, showing consideration and friendliness.
Carries out a chicken sacrifice without hesitation, showing a lack of empathy for the animal.
Follows Lucinnius' request to get a chicken for sacrifice despite tiredness, showing obedience but no initiative.
Navigates the henhouse quietly and politely interacts with other slaves, showing social awareness and tact.
Carries a large satchel of documents and accompanies Lucinnius to an important meeting, indicating responsibility and reliability.
Walks behind Lucinnius and does not attempt to influence or manage the situation with Cyprian, showing passivity.
Keeps an eye on Lucinnius like a mother watching her child, showing concern from a distance.
Plays a game with other slaves while watching Lucinnius, showing a balance of social engagement and attentiveness.
Relaxes and joins Lucinnius with a friendly comment after Lucinnius emerges smiling.
Walks closer than normal to Lucinnius so they can talk, indicating openness and willingness to engage.
Keeps a watchful eye on Lucinnius from a distance, monitoring the situation patiently while engaging in a game, showing calm observation and situational awareness.
Waits for Lucinnius to finish his audience without intervening or offering visible support, possibly indicating restraint or lack of direct influence.
Is shocked and listens to Lucinnius's distress and plans, showing concern.
Expresses confusion and reluctance to help with Lucinnius's plan to die together, indicating emotional distance or inability to support.
Is shocked by Lucinnius's situation but does not offer a clear solution or show understanding of the gravity of the situation.
Expresses confusion and inability to help Lucinnius when asked to participate in a suicide pact.
Expresses confusion and shock upon learning he was named a conspirator without his knowledge.
Shows a close friendship and finds comfort in talking with Gallus, Lucinnius's ten-year-old son, reflecting a caring and sincere connection.
Expresses confusion and shock upon learning he is implicated in a conspiracy he knew nothing about.
Seeks permission to sit down, showing a moment of vulnerability and need to compose himself.
Finds comfort in a child friend, showing emotional intelligence and coping skill in a difficult situation.
Finds comfort in the boy as a substitute for the family he lost.
Engages gently and patiently with Gallus, showing interest in his ideas and teasing lightly.
Expresses tenderness toward Gallus when reminded of their impending death.
Shows concern for his children and their well-being, wanting to know if they are safe and happy.
Engages thoughtfully in a complex discussion about the shape of the world and his home, showing curiosity and reasoning.
Uses a large metal plate as a visual aid to make his point, demonstrating practical thinking.
Admits uncertainty and defers to Gallus to ask Greek for answers, showing openness but also a lack of complete knowledge.
Tries to interpret the chicken's behavior optimistically, suggesting maybe it is just hungry rather than a sign of death.
Offers no help or explanation when Solus is questioned about the repetitive chicken meals, remaining silent and unresponsive.
Interprets the chicken's behavior optimistically, suggesting there might be another way to avoid death despite Lucinnius's grim reading.
Fails to provide any guidance or support to Solus when questioned by Dalmia about the repetitive chicken meals.
Shares a moment of hope with Lucinnius upon hearing visitors might bring good news.
Does not intervene or react when the visitor speaks roughly to him while closing the door.
Shares a moment of hope with Lucinnius upon hearing news from Cyprian, showing awareness of the situation.
Closes the door after the visitors leave, attempting to maintain control of the situation.
Is spoken to roughly by a visitor, suggesting he may be underestimated or challenged, but no further reaction is shown.
Nods obediently while being coached by the Visitor on how to kill, does not show discomfort despite being prodded.
Refuses wine from Lucinnius and expresses desire to die a free man rather than a slave.
Listens attentively and obediently to the Visitor's detailed and unusual coaching on killing, showing self-control by not reacting to being prodded.
Remains cold sober and grim-faced while Lucinnius is drunk and resigned, indicating emotional steadiness and mental clarity.
Expresses a clear and confident desire to die a free man rather than a slave, showing self-awareness and resolve.
Requests a written proclamation of freedom to ensure he dies a free man, showing trust and sincerity.
Follows Lucinnius quietly and supports him despite fear, showing tolerance and good-natured support.
Requests a written proclamation of his freedom to ensure his dignity after death, showing foresight and clarity of purpose.
Keenly watches Lucinnius write the proclamation, indicating attentiveness and involvement.
Calmly asks what he should do next despite the tense situation, showing composure and readiness to act.
Follows Lucinnius quietly with the lamp, supporting him without causing disruption.
Sits beside Lucinnius, speaks gently, helps him lie down, tries to calm him.
Appears to stall or play for time when Lucinnius urges him to act quickly.
Helps Lucinnius lie down gently and tries to calm him, speaking softly and coaxingly.
Sits with Lucinnius without clear plan or action, appearing uncertain about what to do next.
Plays for time when Lucinnius urges him to act quickly, indicating hesitation or lack of immediate decisive action.
Hesitates to kill Lucinnius despite pressure, then throws down the knife and leaves the room.
Takes Lucinnius's coins and certificate of freedom, changes into his cloak and sandals, then pauses and returns to the house after reaching the gate.
Waits to kill Lucinnius despite pressure, showing control and mental strength.
Quickly gathers coins and certificate of freedom, prepares for escape efficiently.
Changes footwear to Lucinnius's sandals before leaving, indicating foresight and practical thinking.
Stops at the gate, looks back, then returns inside, showing caution and reconsideration.
Gently shakes Thalia's shoulder, trying not to wake others; whispers to her to leave quietly and offers freedom and escape.
Boldly addresses the night watchman to divert suspicion, showing confidence and protectiveness.
Hurries on without fully answering Thalia's question about their destination, showing some emotional reserve or guardedness.
Gently wakes Thalia without disturbing others, showing carefulness and awareness.
Whispers to Thalia to hurry and escape, demonstrating decisiveness and urgency.
Boldly addresses the night watchman to divert suspicion, showing confidence and social skill.
Strides off with an authoritative nod, indicating self-assurance.
Noncommittal reply to Thalia about future plans, possibly indicating evasiveness or lack of clear planning.
Approaches crewmen and captain directly to request passage, showing initiative and communication skills.
Wakes Thalia gently to come on deck and shares the novel experience of being at sea with her.
Lies about having been on a ship before, despite Thalia's innocent question.
Negotiates passage with the captain, confidently asserting his need and readiness to leave immediately.
Wakes up promptly when called by the crewman and prepares to go on deck, showing alertness and responsiveness.
Claims prior experience at sea to Thalia, despite it being a lie.
Moves to join Thalia after catching her smile, sharing a quiet, thoughtful moment with her, communicating without words.
Recognizes that the ships are not lost despite initial doubt, showing awareness and ability to reassess the situation.
Sits quietly and thoughtfully, engaging in nonverbal communication with Thalia, indicating emotional intelligence and social awareness.
Exchanges delicate glances and nonverbal communication with the woman in the wagon, showing mutual awareness and subtle connection.
Grabs the sailor's hat from the air and carefully arranges it on his head, showing attentiveness and a small moment of control.
Exchanges delicate glances and nonverbal communication with the woman in the wagon, indicating subtle social awareness and skill.
Looks at the Priest amusedly, sharing silent thoughts with Beatrice; smiles and politely accepts Beatrice's refusal to join him for a walk.
Gestures to Beatrice that he is leaving the wagon to walk for a while and asks her to join him, showing social awareness and calmness amid the Priest's intense monologue.
Looks at the Priest amusedly and shares his thoughts silently with Beatrice, indicating a composed and confident demeanor in a tense situation.
Smiles as the Priest's voice fades, dawdles eating a biscuit, lays down to rest, then attentively listens to distant sounds and investigates the source of a skirmish.
Smiles calmly as the Priest's voice fades, eats a biscuit, lays down to rest, but remains alert to distant sounds and investigates the source of a skirmish despite initial tiredness.
Smiles at Beatrice and shares a playful moment despite language barrier.
Allows his foot to touch Beatrice's and notices she doesn't move away.
Unable to respond or help the sobbing girl who wants to go home, and shows more interest in Beatrice instead.
Runs off wisely to the wagon to seek safety, showing situational awareness.
Communicates playfully with Beatrice despite language barrier, showing social adaptability.
Unable to respond or help the sobbing girl who wants to go home, showing emotional or practical limitation.
More interested in Beatrice than helping the troubled girl, indicating a lack of empathy or priority misjudgment.
Wakes up and quietly follows the suspicious figure to check on Beatrice, showing concern and protectiveness.
Notices suspicious behavior quietly and decides to follow the figure downstairs, showing alertness and caution.
Creeps cautiously into the dark kitchen to investigate the noise, demonstrating careful observation and stealth.
Does not immediately confront the Priest aggressively but recognizes him and relaxes, showing social awareness and control.
Smiles and engages in light-hearted banter with the Priest, showing a friendly and tolerant demeanor.
Does not respond to the Priest's teasing about the widow, but smiles instead, indicating a good-natured and non-confrontational attitude.
Takes a drink of wine offered by the Priest and engages in conversation calmly.
Admits ignorance about the identity of the fighting knights ('I don't know. They all look the same to me.').
Smiles and does not respond directly to the Priest's suggestion to avoid temptation, showing subtle confidence and control over his emotions.
Obeys the Priest without thought, bringing him bread when asked.
Acknowledges the Priest's help in Venice with gratitude.
Remains silent when the Priest mentions the 'little ones' he only talks about when drunk.
Obeys the Priest without thought, showing deference and reliability.
Acknowledges the Priest's help in Venice, indicating awareness and gratitude.
Remains silent when prompted to speak about difficult topics, possibly indicating restraint or avoidance.
Refuses to leave despite danger, stays behind showing concern and solidarity.
Looks with sympathy at the young squire whose father is injured.
Decides not to travel despite the Priest's urging, showing resolve and protective instincts by staying behind with the vulnerable group.
Looks with sympathy at the young squire, indicating emotional awareness and empathy.
Takes time to watch the Squire still kneeling beside his father, quietly stroking the helmet.
Looks at Beatrice and motions for her to follow him outside, away from the chaos.

Takes time to observe the situation carefully, notices the Squire's behavior and the Priest's prayers, and signals Beatrice to follow him outside, indicating situational awareness and calm decision-making.
Engages in playful, intimate communication with Beatrice despite language barrier, showing effort to connect.
Smiles pleased with himself after telling a sad story, then gently corrects Beatrice for laughing, showing sensitivity.
Admits to being far from home and having been locked up and forced to run away, showing vulnerability and openness.
Uses resourcefulness to communicate despite language barrier, employing imaginative storytelling to engage Beatrice.
Acknowledges confusion in communication and attempts to clarify by returning to simpler topics like 'home'.
Smiles, pleased with himself after telling a story that Beatrice finds funny, showing some social confidence.
Tries to have Beatrice say his word for 'home' and insists on his way of communication.
Smiles at Beatrice's delicate touch and accepts her playful interaction with a flea.
Engages in mutual grooming suggestion with Beatrice, showing understanding and intimacy.
Tries to teach Beatrice his word for 'home' and insists on his way of saying it, showing persistence and confidence in communication.
Eventually adapts and says the word in Beatrice's language after she turns the tables, showing flexibility and social intelligence.
Responds politely and gratefully when Beatrice shows him the flea, indicating social awareness and emotional intelligence.
Engages in mutual understanding and suggests moving to a more private spot for grooming, demonstrating social skill and confidence.
Allows Beatrice to groom him and responds appreciatively, reciprocates by tenderly caressing her scalp and neck.
Engages attentively and skillfully in mutual grooming, showing care and focus.
Responds positively and confidently to Beatrice's cues, maintaining composure and sensitivity.
Tenderly grooms Beatrice's hair and scalp, showing delight even in small details like fleas, and expresses interest in her by asking her name sincerely.
Kisses Beatrice gently on the neck while grooming her, responding to her needs and comfort.
Carefully and tenderly probes Beatrice's hair and scalp looking for fleas, showing patience and gentle attention.
Engages in affectionate grooming that transitions into kissing, indicating social and emotional skill in building rapport.
Repeats his own name and asks Beatrice's name, showing some social awkwardness or lack of confidence in conversation.
Makes love quietly with Beatrice in the dark, sharing an intimate moment that also involves a playful act to confound the Priest.
Shares a cheeky, mocking smile with Beatrice towards the Priest, engaging in a playful but potentially exclusionary act.
Makes love quietly with Beatrice in the dark, enjoying the thrill of confounding the Priest.
Emerges from a pile of clothing and participates in a cheeky act of innocence to mock the Priest.
Is in a cheerful mood, pleased with himself and his success with Beatrice.
Dismisses the Priest's warnings about Beatrice, saying 'Witch my arse. Stop giving me orders.'
Engages in a tense, confusing conversation with the Priest, spoiling their friendship.
Calls out to the Priest what might be an attempt at an apology or a taunt: 'I don't understand you.'
Is cheerful and pleased with his success with Beatrice, showing confidence in his social interactions.
Refuses to be ordered around by the Priest, asserting his independence and judgment.
Engages in a confusing and somewhat antagonistic exchange with the Priest, spoiling their friendship.
Calls out to the Priest with a statement that might be an apology or a taunt, showing some social awareness but also potential misjudgment.
Chatter freely with Beatrice despite language barrier, showing openness and friendliness.
Feeds Beatrice a piece of cheese from his knife, demonstrating care and generosity.
Responds to Beatrice's invitation with eagerness and tenderness, kissing and caressing her affectionately.
Feeds Beatrice a piece of cheese from his knife and shares intimacy despite language barrier.
Throws down his knife and cheese to lie down with Beatrice and respond to her advances confidently.
Engages in playful, affectionate behavior showing emotional intelligence and social skill.
Stops kissing when Beatrice giggles persistently, shows awareness of surroundings.
Cautiously approaches and acknowledges the dead body with Beatrice, showing sensitivity to the situation.
Continues to look at the figure despite Beatrice's anxiety and suggestion to leave, showing some insensitivity or lack of immediate empathy.
Notices the figure by the stream and correctly identifies it as a dead man, showing observational skill and some deduction.
Continues kissing without understanding the situation initially, showing a lack of awareness.
Decides to approach the dead body cautiously and investigates the scene, demonstrating cautious and capable behavior.
Hesitates and takes time to work out what he is seeing, indicating some uncertainty or slower processing.
Helps Beatrice cover the dead boy's head with stones, showing respect and care for the deceased.
Smiles at Beatrice proudly showing off the shoes she exchanged with the dead boy, sharing a moment of warmth and connection.
Helps Beatrice gather stones to cover the squire's head, showing practical assistance in a somber situation.
Acknowledges the limitations of their efforts by noting the stones won't keep wolves away, showing realistic understanding.
Smiles at Beatrice's playful exchange of shoes and enjoys the moment, showing emotional engagement but no clear demonstration of skill or intelligence.
Enjoys Beatrice's company and responds positively to her love talk.
Watches Beatrice's ceremony with fascination but keeps a respectful distance, showing tolerance and respect.
Suggests leaving the site after the ceremony, showing consideration for the situation and Beatrice's feelings.
Engages in gentle conversation about 'mama', showing openness and a desire to connect.
Watches Beatrice's ceremony with fascination but keeps a safe distance, showing caution and awareness.
Engages in lighthearted, somewhat confused conversation with Beatrice, showing limited understanding of the situation.
Suggests leaving the scene after the ceremony, indicating practical judgment and situational awareness.
Watches Beatrice with fascination and attentiveness as she milks the cow and sleeps, showing gentle interest and care.
Remembers and follows Ronald's advice to keep the sun on his back and stay on one side of the river, showing careful attention to guidance and navigation.
Engages distractedly while Beatrice explains milking, unable to focus fully on learning the skill.
Sniffs her dried flowers and herbs with curiosity, lying beside her peacefully.
Follows Beatrice quietly, smiling as she chats with the boatman, showing acceptance and patience.
Expresses uncertainty about their direction honestly and openly.
Sits quietly with a smile, following Beatrice and the boatman without understanding their conversation.
Expresses uncertainty about their direction and suggests they are going the wrong way, indicating some situational awareness.
Follows Beatrice passively, 'tagging along' as if caught in her wake, showing a lack of initiative or leadership.
Hesitates before following Beatrice into her home, showing respect for her space and feelings.
Looks at Beatrice in silence when she expresses her wish for him to stay, indicating attentiveness and consideration.
Asks about the cause of Arnaud's death, showing concern and interest in Beatrice's past.
Hesitates before following Beatrice into the house.
Looks around the small dark room silently, showing observation.
Asks directly about Arnaud's death, showing some engagement and seeking information.
Listens quietly and respectfully to Beatrice's shy and affectionate advances without mocking or rejecting her.
Keeps his feelings to himself and does not respond to Beatrice's direct expressions of liking him.
Understands Beatrice's meaning gradually but keeps his feelings to himself, showing some internal confusion and hesitation.
Climbs the ladder to join Beatrice in the attic space, physically capable and willing to engage.
Considers taking up Beatrice's offer immediately, indicating some decisiveness and social awareness.
Stands quietly, unsure how to act when introduced to Beatrice's family, showing vulnerability and respect.
Politely asks for water and a moment to compose himself, using mime to communicate, indicating humility and non-imposition.
Stands confused and unsure when introduced to Beatrice's family, not immediately knowing how to behave.
Asks for water and a place to wash using mime, showing resourcefulness and nonverbal communication skills.
Politely insists the Mother take the good chair and offers to sit on the box, gently pacifying her concerns.
Politely insists the Mother take the better seat and gently pacifies her unhappiness, showing tact and consideration.
Stands shyly at the door watching the Mother instead of engaging more actively or decisively.
Retreats to the yard without making a clear decision despite having some to make.
Joins the Boy in his work despite initial clumsiness, responds positively to the Boy's smile and invitation to smell the jar.
Observes Beatrice's effort in preparing the meal with a sense of guilt and shared understanding.
Allows the old Mother to serve herself first at the meal, taking only a modest portion despite the old Mother's excessive appetite.
Joins the Boy in the work despite initial clumsiness and shows curiosity by sniffing the jar of liquid.
Leans over the cauldron without thinking and is assaulted by a hideous odor, showing a lack of caution.
Observes and tries to understand the situation by asking about the color for cloth and clarifying the meaning of 'peepee'.
Allows the old Mother to serve herself first, submitting to the social power dynamics at the table and taking only a modest portion.
Opens his heart to Beatrice, sharing his feelings honestly despite awkwardness.
Expresses liking Beatrice sincerely and compliments her.
Leaves abruptly, feeling it would be wrong to stay only briefly, showing respect for boundaries.
Opens his heart to Beatrice, expressing his feelings honestly despite awkwardness.
Fumbles awkwardly with his bag while saying goodbye, showing discomfort and lack of smoothness.
Makes an effort to appear relaxed despite inner unhappiness, showing some self-awareness and control.
Sits down and closes his eyes by the river when the boatman is gone and it is dark, possibly indicating passivity or lack of immediate problem-solving.
Speaks to Andre, sharing a peaceful dream and acknowledging the harsh reality around them.
Speaks calmly to Andre and reflects on a dream despite the dire situation.
Looks around at the squalid mass of distressed humanity and expresses despair ('God, this is the worst, the worst').
Responds to Andre's question with a dark joke about eating him.
Watches a man and woman with a gaze that reflects recognition of pain and antipathy, showing awareness of others' suffering.
Responds to Andre's question with a confident, somewhat humorous retort, indicating self-assurance and mental sharpness.
Observes the people around him carefully, noting details and emotional undercurrents, showing situational awareness and perceptiveness.
Works hard rowing the raft alongside others.
Overpowers Ursula to take her load despite her refusal, angrily dumps it on the sand.
Works his oar with the rest, actively participates in rowing the raft through dangerous surf.
Overpowers Ursula to take her load and carries it to shore despite her refusal, showing physical capability and determination.
Nudges Nuno out of the way to help Ursula, taking initiative in a critical moment.
Focuses attention on Ursula during a chaotic and dangerous situation, indicating situational awareness and concern.
Offers to share his carpet and cloth to help Francisco and Ursula build a better shelter, attempting to heal past wounds.
Accepts Francisco's harsh rejection without retaliation, responding quietly with 'Well......'.
Attempts to collaborate with Francisco by offering materials and proposing to build a better shelter together.
Carries his own possessions with Andre, echoing his past as a slave, showing awareness and humility but no direct display of skill or confidence here.
Does not push further after Francisco's rejection, showing restraint but possibly a missed opportunity to assert himself or negotiate.
Walks briskly toward the trouble with Francisco, showing readiness to engage the situation.
Does not intervene or speak during the heated exchange between Francisco and Dom Paulo, remaining a passive observer.
Hesitates to vote for the death of the Deserters, visibly conflicted and communicates silently with one Deserter, ultimately drops his hand initially.
Eventually raises his hand to vote for the death under pressure from the majority and Salgado's stern gaze.
